description: A forbidden sacred ground in Skypiea where God Enel and his priests reside. Originally part of the island of Jaya, Upper Yard was blasted into the sky 400 years ago by a Knock Up Stream. It is the ancestral homeland of the Shandia people and the site of the ancient city of Shandora.

keyEvents.title: Nola Emerges in Upper Yard
keyEvents.description: The giant python Nola appears from the forest of Upper Yard and attacks the Straw Hat exploration team.
keyEvents.significance: Upper Yard's ancient forest is revealed to house creatures from 400 years ago, emphasizing its status as a preserved piece of the Blue Sea.

keyEvents.title: Exploration Team Scatters Across Upper Yard
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hats are forced to separate across Upper Yard's vast forest while fleeing from Nola.
keyEvents.significance: The geography of Upper Yard becomes a key element in the Survival Game as characters navigate its forests and ruins.

keyEvents.title: Upper Yard Becomes the Battlefield
keyEvents.description: Upper Yard is established as the primary battleground where the Straw Hats, Shandia warriors, and Enel's priests will all converge.
keyEvents.significance: Upper Yard transforms from a mysterious location into the active stage for the arc's climactic conflicts.

statusHistory.reason: Upper Yard is the active location for the Skypiea Arc's main conflicts

description: The home village of the Shandia people, located on one of Skypiea's clouds. The Shandia have lived here since being displaced from their ancestral homeland of Upper Yard 400 years ago. The village serves as the base for Shandia warriors preparing to reclaim their homeland.

keyEvents.title: Shandia Chief Appears in Village
keyEvents.description: The Shandia Chief is shown in the village in his role as the leader of the Shandia people.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the village as the home and command center for the Shandia warriors.

keyEvents.title: Isa and Raki's Conversation
keyEvents.description: Isa and Raki discuss Aisa and Wyper in the village, showing the community dynamics.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the village as a living community with families and relationships beyond just warriors.

keyEvents.title: Warriors Depart from Village
keyEvents.description: Wyper and the Shandia warriors prepare and depart from the village to attack Upper Yard.
keyEvents.significance: The village serves as the launching point for the Shandia's assault in the Survival Game.

statusHistory.reason: The Shandia Village is the active home base for the Shandia people

description: The Straw Hat Pirates' first ship, a caravel designed by Merry and given to them by Kaya. Currently sailing through the White Sea near Skypiea.

keyEvents.title: Gan Fall's History Lesson on the Merry
keyEvents.description: Gan Fall recounts the 400-year history of the Shandia-Sky Island war to Nami, Sanji, and Usopp aboard the Going Merry.
keyEvents.significance: The Going Merry serves as a safe location for exposition and character development while the exploration team is in danger.

keyEvents.title: Explanation of Enel's Rule Aboard Merry
keyEvents.description: Gan Fall explains Enel's takeover six years ago while on the Going Merry.
keyEvents.significance: The ship provides a gathering point for the crew to learn about Skypiea's complex political situation.

statusHistory.reason: The Going Merry is the Straw Hats' active ship during this period
